;;乌克兰炮兵部队的一名成员携带弹药
;

;弗拉基米尔·泽连斯基 (Volodymyr Zelenskiy) 否认了来自乌克兰军方总司令表示，与俄罗斯的战争已;，并补充道：“很可能不会出现深刻而美丽的突破。”

;

;扎鲁日尼表示，战争已进入消耗战阶段，除非技术取得突破，否则双方都不会取得太大进展。他还表示，俄罗斯凭借其数量优势正在慢慢占据上风。

;

;这位将军表示，他低估了弗拉基米尔·普京牺牲自己士兵的意愿，称迄今为止至少有 15 万人被杀。 “说实话，[俄罗斯]是一个封建国家，最便宜的资源就是人命。对我们来说……我们拥有的最昂贵的东西就是我们的人民。”扎卢日尼说。

;

;他承认，长期的战斗使乌克兰处于不利地位。 “这将使俄罗斯受益，使其能够重建军事力量，最终威胁乌克兰武装部队和国家本身。”周六，泽连斯基否认战争陷入僵局，并表示将与盟友进行更多合作需要加强防空。

;

;“今天时间已经过去，人们也很疲惫，但这并不是僵局，”他在与来访的欧盟委员会主席乌尔苏拉·冯德莱恩举行的新闻发布会上说道。 “俄罗斯控制着天空。我们关心我们的军队。”

;

;泽连斯基承认战争已经进入第 21 个月，他承认基辅的反攻尚未取得任何重大成功。

;

; p>;

;但他表示，乌克兰军队别无选择，只能继续战斗，并需要西方盟国的更多支持，尤其是防空力量。

;

;乌克兰军队在反攻中穿过俄罗斯广阔的雷区，进展缓慢。 6月初从东部和南部开始，但俄罗斯在东部进行了猛烈反击。

;

;泽连斯基的助手伊霍尔·佐夫科瓦(Ihor Zhovkva)谴责了扎卢日尼的言论，警告称这些言论可能会被俄罗斯利用。

;

; “如果我是军人，我最不想做的事情就是向媒体和公众评论前线正在发生的事情、前线可能发生的事情以及可能的选择，”他说在基辅独立报报道的电视讲话中。

;

;“因为这样我们会让侵略者的工作变得更容易。我确信所有内容都经过了非常仔细的阅读和记录，并得出了结论。”

;

;Zhovkva 补充道：“如果我们能够以这种方式取得成功，那么也许这是一个非常深入的战略计划。但这对我来说似乎很奇怪。”

;

;克里姆林宫也对扎卢日尼对冲突状况的评估提出了异议。周四，当被记者问到扎卢日尼关于冲突正在走向僵局的说法是否正确时，克里姆林宫发言人德米特里·佩斯科夫表示：“不，事情还没有陷入僵局。”

;

;他说这是“荒谬的”基辅谈论乌克兰可能在战场上取得胜利。佩斯科夫补充道：“基辅政权越早认识到这一点，前景就会越早显现。”

;

;周五，泽连斯基宣布任命一位新指挥官负责乌克兰特种部队。他没有对这一任命做出解释。

;

;泽伦斯基在夜间视频讲话中表示，谢尔盖·卢潘丘克上校现在将领导部队，并称他是“一位经验丰富的军官、战斗军官和合适的指挥者”。

;

;总统表示，卢潘丘克的前任、自 2022 年 7 月起领导部队的维克托·霍伦科少将将继续在国防部情报局内执行“特殊任务”。
;
; 霍伦科在接受采访时表示，他没有被告知任何事情。 “我个人并不知道原因。我只想说，我是从媒体了解到这一点的，”他告诉《乌克兰真理报》新闻网站。
;
;乌克兰特种部队被认为是其军队在俄罗斯控制下地区进行的最复杂行动的幕后黑手，特别是克里米亚，克里米亚于 2014 年被莫斯科吞并，比莫斯科全面入侵陆地早了八年。

;

;最近的例子包括 9 月对俄罗斯黑海舰队司令部位于塞瓦斯托波尔的总部发动的袭击，以及对一艘巡逻船和一艘潜艇驻扎在半岛上。

;

;;路透社为本报告提供了资料。;

; Sun, 05 Nov 2023 22:52:02 +0800 ‘Funk is the reality we live’: Rio de Janeiro show celebrates the sound of the favelahttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/05/funk-is-the-reality-we-live-rio-de-janeiro-show-celebrates-the-sound-of-the-favela
;;2023-11-05T13:45:59Z;
;
;;画的是一个金色头发和黑色短上衣的人
;

;赫伯特·阿莫林八岁时第一次尝到;funk carioca;（里约放克）：;一张盗版 CD;，作者：Mr卡特拉 (Catra) 是一名贫民窟主持人，以其有关帮派、枪支和性的凶猛而露骨的诗句而闻名。

;

;“我妈妈发现我在听这首歌，然后就疯了，”这位来自卡马拉参议员的 30 岁视觉艺术家说道，里约热内卢西部一个贫瘠的角落，警察不敢踏足。

;

;阿莫林被迷住了。几年后，他偷偷溜去参加他的第一次贫民窟放克派对，并告诉妈妈他住在朋友家。 “我到了那里就问：‘这是什么？;;？有一种超现实的能量，”他描述了他亲眼目睹并现在在拼贴画中重现的 DJ、舞者、武器和珠宝的震撼碰撞。

;
;

;;相关：;;“我们想要污染街道！”：艺术家与博尔索纳罗战斗 - 穿着动物服装;

;
;

;阿莫林的作品是里约艺术博物馆新展览中的 900 件作品之一（三月）庆祝放克运动及其在巴西社会、文化和政治中的作用。该展览由一些巴西最受好评的年轻艺术家以及摄影师 ;Vincent Rosenblatt; 等外国人参加，据说是第一次一家顶级博物馆专门为这一流派举办了整个展览。

;

;;funk carioca;诞生已有三十多年了，它拥有六种以上的子流派和歌词，他们对黑社会生活的颂扬是肮脏的、轻浮的、具有政治意识的还是完全非法的——对其根源的争论仍然激烈。有人称其为迈阿密贝斯和黑帮说唱的南美融合。其他人则认为它源自一种名为 ;Maculelê; 的非洲裔巴西节奏。

;

;Marcelo Campos，MAR总策展人表示，;这场展览;是一次故意的反驳对于艺术势利人士来说，他们认为博物馆应该只展示巴西以白人为主的精英的“高雅文化”，并认为放克是“亡命之徒的东西”。

;

;“这是一个试图彻底翻开这一理念的展览放克是一种禁忌，”坎波斯在参观演出的两个大厅时说道——一个重点关注里约热内卢的黑人历史，另一个重点关注贫民窟放克运动本身。 “我们要传达的信息是，[放克]绝对是一流的文化。”

;

;对于阿莫林来说，令人惊讶的不是一个重要的博物馆正在举办一场关于放克的展览，而是以前从未发生过这种情况。 “事实上，这件事早就该发生了。芬克是我们这个时代最伟大的遗产之一——如果不是;最;的话，”这位艺术家坐在屋顶上观察激发他作品灵感的区域时说道。

; <图表数据-media-id="e23ebd8ab5e1713d69ad6b2b862f0421419ba5a8">; ;Pixinuinha;。当今;贫民窟放克音乐;的前身;;bailes;;（舞蹈）始于 20 世纪 70 年代，当时音乐爱好者挤满郊区夜总会，聆听詹姆斯·布朗 (James Brown) 的音乐和库尔&

;

;这些灵魂乐和放克舞蹈后来转移到了贫民窟——如今里约热内卢 660 万居民中有 20% 居住在贫民窟——并随着阿莫林在 20 世纪 90 年代和 2000 年代的成长，成为一种震耳欲聋的文化和社会现象。如今，里约最大的;狂欢节;（许多以埃及、荷兰、莫斯科和伦敦等外国或城市命名）吸引了数以万计的狂欢者，并成为当地经济的重要组成部分。

;

;“当举办放克派对时，你可以忘记睡觉。就像音乐在你的家里播放一样，”阿莫林谈到他儿时的家附近发生的震耳欲聋的通宵狂欢。

;

;阿莫林称放克是一种记录和庆祝残酷现实的方式。里约热内卢贫民窟的控制权已大部分交给全副武装的贩毒集团。 “芬克是讲述生活中赤裸裸的真相。放克是我们生活的现实，”他说。 “这是每个人都看到但没有人愿意讨论的事情。”

;

;Amorim，其艺名是 ;Artedeft; ，希望通过他的拼贴画达到类似的效果，这些拼贴画将贫民窟的生活场景与梵高、爱德华·蒙克和保罗·高更等画家的“样本”混合在一起。 “我谈论的是就在我面前的里约热内卢——如果你往街上看，无论你从哪个方向看，你都会看到我的艺术作品，”这位艺术家说，直到看到萨尔瓦多·达利的作品后，他才参观了艺术博物馆回顾他21岁时的情况。

; ;

;展览中的另一位艺术家，;25 岁的胡安·卡尔维特;说，他在收到 MAR 的邀请后哭了。三年前他才参观了他的第一个博物馆。 “这是一次非常强大的经历，你知道吗？来到博物馆，以多种不同的方式看待自己。”卡尔维特说道。

;

;来自贫民窟的博物馆参观者在用放克风格的雕塑和画布自拍时表达了类似的感受，这些雕塑和画布讲述了他们的生活。

;

; p>;

;“我看到了自己，”四十多岁的跨性别女性安德烈亚·桑帕约·达席尔瓦 (Andreia Sampaio da Silva) 回忆起她年轻时经常参加的;bailes de corredor;（“走廊舞”）时说道，竞争对手的放克团体在那里举行经常演变成暴力的舞蹈比赛。

;

;坎波斯认为根深蒂固的不宽容和精英主义解释了为什么博物馆以前回避放克和贫民窟。

;

;“放克遭受苦难桑巴舞也遭受同样的偏见。桑巴舞也被认为是亡命之徒的玩意儿。人们被逮捕了。演出停播。歌词被禁止，”策展人说道，他希望 MAR 通过反映当代社会的展览来挑战这种先入为主的观念。

;

;“像人们长期以来的想法一样，继续认为最好的做法是没有意义的。这里通过展示蒙娜丽莎来教育社会。这不再是问题了。”

; Sun, 05 Nov 2023 21:52:01 +0800 PSOE members back Catalan amnesty plan to secure power in Spainhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/05/psoe-members-back-catalan-amnesty-plan-to-secure-power-in-spain
;;2023-11-05T13:38:02Z;
;
;;Pedro Sánchez
;

;西班牙社会主义工人党 (PSOE) 成员支持计划确保该党领导人佩德罗·桑切斯连任总理，以换取对参与非法和单边活动的人进行极具争议的特赦;六年前争取加泰罗尼亚独立;。

;

;西班牙一直掌握在桑切斯的看守政府自;7月以来尚无定论提前举行大选;，社会工人党以微弱优势被保守的人民党 (PP) 击败。尽管人民党赢得了最多席位，但未能获得议会多数席位，并且 ;事实证明，即使得到极右翼 Vox 党和其他较小政治团体的支持，也无法组建政府。

;

;桑切斯和他的左翼盟友苏马尔联盟;最有可能组建政府，但只有在加泰罗尼亚支持独立的两个主要政党加泰罗尼亚左翼共和党（ERC）和联合党（Jints）的支持下才能成立。加泰罗尼亚两党均表示，他们对让西班牙工人社会党重新执政的支持取决于对参与 2017 年 10 月失败的西班牙独立运动的数百人的特赦。

;

;虽然 ERC 已在与西班牙社会工人党 (PSOE) 签署协议后，由前加泰罗尼亚地区主席卡莱斯·普伊格德蒙特 (Carles Puigdemont) 领导的 Junts 仍在就加泰罗尼亚独立的支持进行谈判，他仍因在加泰罗尼亚独立运动中所扮演的角色而被西班牙法院通缉。

;

;在本周的投票之后——其中没有明确使用“特赦”一词——;87% 的 PSOE 成员;表示，他们赞成“与苏马尔达成协议，组建政府并吸引支持其他政治组织以获得必要的多数”。该党表示，11.9% 的党员投票反对这项协议，63.4% 的党员投票了。

;

;PSOE 组织秘书 Santos Cerdán León 表示，结果证明了党员的愿望避免将更多权力交给 PP 和 Vox，他们已经发起了罢工 ;西班牙许多城镇和地区的执政联盟;。

;

;“当西班牙社会工人党做出决定时，成员们的声音会响亮而清晰， ”;他周日说道;。 “面对人民党和怀旧极右翼统治的城镇和地区所采取的倒退措施，我们唯一的动机是继续加强福利国家。”

;

;人民党攻击了桑切斯因在特赦上屈服，称此举是胆怯、愤世嫉俗和赤裸裸地试图保住权力。

;

;经过数周的暗示和猜测，代理总理终于在上周末确认了计划中的措施。 “为了西班牙的利益，为了捍卫西班牙人之间的共存，我今天捍卫加泰罗尼亚对过去十年事件的特赦，”桑切斯上周六在马德里举行的政党联邦委员会会议上说道。

;

;PSOE领导人，曾经;承诺让普伊格德蒙特回归两年前，;赦免九位加泰罗尼亚领导人;，推动分裂国家。

;

;9 月中旬的一项民意调查显示，;70%的西班牙人反对;特赦，约20万人参加了最近反对这项措施的集会由 PP 和 Vox 组织。

;

;PP 领导人阿尔贝托·努涅斯·费霍 (Alberto Núñez Feijóo) 多次指责桑切斯出卖加泰罗尼亚和巴斯克民族主义政党。费乔说：“我们的法治正在被一个由属于不同类别的公民组成的国家所取代——一个政治精英，他们可以交换福利，但不受与其他西班牙人相同的法律的约束，而这些精英将西班牙人视为第二梯队。”在星期天。 “但是这些乙级联赛的西班牙人不会低头或保持沉默。面对这种欺骗和对我们民主的攻击，我们不会闭嘴。”

;

;尽管 ERC 和 Junts 抓住了拟议的大赦作为复兴的手段 ;停滞不前的地区独立运动; 他们各自竞相代表、支持独立的加泰罗尼亚近年来直线下滑。

;

;2017年10月危机最严重时，加泰罗尼亚政府民意研究中心的一项调查发现，48.7%的加泰罗尼亚人支持独立，43.6%不支持。根据同一中心;7月份进行的调查;，52%的加泰罗尼亚人现在反对独立，42% 的人赞成。

;

;桑切斯和他的盟友必须在 11 月 27 日之前尝试获得国会的支持来组建新政府。如果失败，议会将被解散，西班牙将在一月份重返投票站，举行九年来的第六次大选。

; Sun, 05 Nov 2023 21:52:01 +0800 Record numbers of refugees arrive in Canary Islands by boathttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/05/record-numbers-of-refugees-arrive-in-canary-islands-by-boat
;;2023-11-05T12:01:11Z;
;
;;2020 年 10 月加那利群岛大加那利岛阿吉内金码头难民使用的小船
;

;今年到目前为止，已有近 32,000 名男性、女性和儿童乘船抵达加那利群岛 ;世界上最致命的迁徙路线;，打破了 17 年来抵达西班牙群岛的记录。

;

;周五和周六当天，四艘船共载有739人，抵达加那利群岛最小、最西端的耶罗岛。其中有两人的尸体，他们在从非洲出发的危险的大西洋航线上丧生。另有两人在医院死亡。

;

;最新抵达的人数使今年年初以来到达该群岛的总人数达到 31,933 人。 ;;2006 年“la Crisis de los cayucos”;;（小船危机），有 31,678 人到达加那利群岛。

;

;根据西班牙国家统计局的数据内政部，;仅 10 月份就有 14,976 人抵达加那利群岛;，增加了岛屿基础设施的巨大压力。

;

;加那利群岛地区总统费尔南多·克拉维霍 (Fernando Clavijo)表示，这一里程碑凸显了这些岛屿所面临的人道主义挑战的规模，并再次呼吁西班牙政府和欧盟提供进一步帮助。

;

;“数字不应压倒一切，但在这种情况下，它们定义加那利群岛的人道主义紧急情况，”;他在 X;（以前称为 Twitter）上写道。 “已经超过了 2006 年的数字，但国家和欧盟的反应并不相同。管理南部边境的移民应该成为西班牙和欧洲议程中的优先事项。”专门研究移民问题的记者、加那利群岛政府前顾问 Txema Santana 表示，大量移民本周末抵达以及四人死亡是即将发生的事情的又一个迹象。

;

;“进入 11 月，如此密集的[抵达]将导致大量死亡和失踪人员，” ;他在 X; 上说道。

;

;今年的入境人数已经是去年的两倍多。根据国际移民组织的数据，2022 年 1 月至 12 月期间，;15,682人从西非乘船到达加那利群岛;，比上一年减少6,634人，减少30%。

;

; Sun, 05 Nov 2023 20:22:02 +0800 Elon Musk unveils Grok, an AI chatbot with a ‘rebellious streak’https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2023/nov/05/elon-musk-unveils-grok-an-ai-chatbot-with-a-rebellious-streak
;;2023-11-05T11:58:15Z;
;
;;埃隆·马斯克
;

;埃隆·马斯克推出了 Grok，一款具有“叛逆气质”的人工智能聊天机器人” 灵感来自《银河系漫游指南》。

;

;特斯拉首席执行官，;上周警告;，人工智能是“对人类最大的威胁之一”，并表示将制造 ChatGPT 的竞争对手经过测试后，可以在他的 X 平台上向高级订阅者开放。

;

;马斯克还透露，Grok 可以访问他拥有的 X 上的用户帖子，并且喜欢讽刺性的回复。

; <图数据-canonical-url="https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1720660977786433810">;
;

;Grok 可以通过 𝕏 平台实时访问信息，这是一个与其他模型相比具有巨大优势。
;
;它也是基于&喜欢讽刺。我不知道是谁能以这种方式引导它 🤷‍♂️ 🤣 ;pic.twitter.com/e5OwuGvZ3Z;

; - Elon Musk ( @elonmusk) ;2023 年 11 月 4 日;
; ;

;马斯克发布这是 Grok 俏皮语气的一个明显例子，其中有一个屏幕截图，其中显示了对聊天机器人的询问，要求它提供制作可卡因的“一步一步”指南。回复中概述的四个步骤包括“获得化学学位”和“在偏远地区建立秘密实验室”。

;

;然而，聊天机器人在最后补充道：“开个玩笑！请不要真的尝试制造可卡因。这是非法的、危险的，我不会鼓励这样做。”

; ;

;马斯克说Grok，这是处于早期测试阶段，尚未向公众开放，最终将发布给 X 顶级订阅服务 Premium+ 的订阅者。

;

;Grok 是美国科幻小说作家 Robert A Heinlein 创造的一个动词，根据柯林斯词典的意思是“彻底、直观地理解”。

;
;

;;相关：;;人工智能不是问题，总理——控制的公司是 | John Naughton;

;
;

;Grok 是由 Musk 的新人工智能公司 xAI 打造的。 xAI 的工作人员在周六的一篇博文中解释了该聊天机器人得益于英国作家道格拉斯·亚当斯 (Douglas Adams) 创作的邪教科幻喜剧《银河系漫游指南》。

;

;“Grok 是一款模仿《银河系漫游指南》的人工智能到银河系，因此旨在回答几乎所有问题，更难的是，甚至建议要问什么问题！

;

;“Grok 旨在用一点智慧回答问题，并且具有叛逆性，所以请不要如果你讨厌幽默，就不要使用它！”

;

;xAI 团队表示，Grok 由名为 Grok-1 的大型语言模型（AI 聊天机器人背后的基础技术）提供支持。

;

;博文称，在解决中学数学问题等一些基准测试中，Grok-1 已经超越了 ChatGPT 免费版本中使用的模型 GPT-3.5。然而，xAI 表示，它落后于最强大的 ChatGPT 模型 GPT-4。

;

;“只有使用大量训练数据和计算机资源进行训练的模型（例如 GPT-4）才能超越它。 ”

;

;xAI 团队表示，Grok 作为原型向美国有限数量的用户提供，并补充说“新功能和特性”将在未来几个月内推出。;根据 Grok 网站;，根据“早期访问计划”向 X 订阅者提供对聊天机器人的初始访问。

;

;马斯克是 ChatGPT 背后的公司 OpenAI 的联合创始人，但他于 2018 年离开该公司，称他“不同意 OpenAI 团队想做的一些事情”，并引用了他在其他公司的承诺。马斯克对 OpenAI 等公司的开发速度表示担忧，并在 3 月份支持暂停开发强大系统六个月的呼吁。

;

;然而，7 月份马斯克表示暂停似乎不再现实。并;宣布成立xAI;，他说这将“以一种好的方式”构建人工智能系统。

;

;在人工智能安全峰会上发表讲话;上周在布莱切利公园;，马斯克表示人工智能对人类构成威胁，这呼应了一些专家和技术高管的担忧，即可能会出现逃避人类控制并做出危害人类的决策的系统。

;

;“我的意思是，我们第一次遇到这样的情况：有些事情正在发生比最聪明的人类聪明得多。”他说。

;

;马斯克周四预测，人工智能（AI，指能够执行通常与智能生物相关的任务的计算机系统）将取代所有人类工作。他对总理里希·苏纳克 (Rishi Sunak) 说：“总有一天，不再需要工作。”

; Sun, 05 Nov 2023 20:22:02 +0800 Philippines radio journalist shot dead during live broadcasthttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/05/philippines-radio-journalist-juan-jumalon-shot-dead-during-live-broadcast
;;2023-11-05T11:42:45Z;
;
;;Juan Jumalon
;

;菲律宾南部的一名电台主播被一名室内男子开枪打死his studio in a brazen attack witnessed by people watching the programme live on Facebook.

;

;The gunman gained entry into the home-based radio station of the provincial news broadcaster Juan Jumalon, known also as DJ Johnny Walker, by pretending to be a listener. He then shot him twice during a live morning broadcast in Calamba town in Misamis Occidental province, police said.

;

;The attacker snatched the victim's gold necklace before fleeing with a companion, who was waiting outside Jumalon's house, onboard a motorcycle, police said. An investigation was under way to identify the gunman and establish if the attack was work-related.

;

;The Philippines has long been regarded as one of the most dangerous places in the world for journalists.

;

;President Ferdinand Marcos Jr strongly condemned the shooting and said he ordered the national police to track down, arrest and prosecute the killers.

;

;“Attacks on journalists will not be tolerated in our democracy and those who threaten the freedom of the press will face the full consequences of their actions,” Marcos said in a statement.

;

;The National Union of Journalists of the Philippines, a press freedom watchdog, said Jumalon was the 199th journalist to be killed in the country since 1986, when democracy returned after a “People Power” uprising toppled the dictator Ferdinand Marcos, the father of the current president, and forced him and his family into exile in the US.

;

;“The attack is even more condemnable since it happened at Jumalon's own home, which also served as the radio station,” the watchdog said.

;

;A video of the attack shows Jumalon, 57, pausing and looking upward at something away from the camera before two shots rang out. He slumped back in his chair as background music played on. He was pronounced dead on the way to hospital.

;

;The attacker was not seen on the Facebook livestream but police said they were checking if security cameras installed in the house and at his neighbours recorded anything.

;

;In 2009, members of a powerful political clan and their associates gunned down 58 people, including 32 media workers, in a brazen execution-style attack in southern Maguindanao province. It was the deadliest single attack on journalists in recent history.

;

;While the mass killing was later linked to a violent electoral rivalry common in many rural areas, it also showcased the threats faced by journalists in the Philippines. A surfeit of unlicensed guns and private armies controlled by powerful clans and weak law enforcement in rural regions are among the security concerns journalists face in the poverty-stricken south-east Asian country.

;

;The Glastonbury co-organiser Emily Eavis has said reports that Madonna has been confirmed to headline Glastonbury next year are “untrue”.

;

;On Saturday evening, reports claimed Madonna, Dua Lipa and Coldplay were set to top the bill on the Pyramid Stage at the festival in June.

;

;Eavis denied the claims in an Instagram post on Sunday morning, writing: “As always, there is much speculation and excitement about who is playing at Glastonbury.

;

;“We are working on the line-up day and night at the moment, but it's still changing every day. The story about our confirmed headliners is untrue.

;

;“As always, we love your enthusiasm and guesswork – but accurate news on headliners will be with you sometime in the new year!”

;

;Were she to be confirmed, it would be Madonna's first time performing at Glastonbury.

;

;Dua Lipa has also never headlined the event. It would make it the first time that two female artists have headlined in the festival's history.

;

;The Mail on Sunday reported that Madonna, 65, was understood to have agreed to close the festival on the Sunday night on the Pyramid stage. Lipa was said to be Friday's headline act while Coldplay, who have headlined four times previously in 2002, 2005, 2011 and 2016, were reported to be playing on Saturday.

;

;Next year's festival in Worthy Farm, Somerset, is scheduled to take place on 26–30 June.

;

;Last year, the lineup was all male with Arctic Monkeys, Guns N' Roses and Sir Elton John performing.

;

;Last month, Eavis, the daughter of the Glastonbury founder, Michael Eavis, said the “legend” slot on Sunday teatime would be a female artist. She also disclosed that a “really big” female US singer's team had got in touch with her to say she was available, believed to be Madonna.

;

;Eavis told Annie Mac and Nick Grimshaw's Sidetracked podcast: “2024 is still a little up in the air, and I thought it was taking shape, then last week I just got a call, and this is what happens if you wait a little longer, because often we'll be booked up from July.

;

;“This year we're holding out for a little bit longer and last week I got a call from a really big American artist saying this person's around next year, and I was like: 'Oh my God, this is incredible.' Thank God we held the slot.”

;

;No performers for the 2024 festival have yet been officially announced.

;

;Addressing the lack of female headliners, Eavis added: “I've always been really passionate about gender split [on festival line-ups] and I think, actually, our problem was that I'd been so outspoken about it that having a year when there wasn't a female sent people a bit mad – or some people.

;

;“And we did have a female – she pulled out and we replaced them with Guns N' Roses. But everyone knows that it's top of my list.

;

;“It is difficult with female artists because there aren't enough headliners. But we're also creating them.

;

;“We're putting the bands and female artists on smaller stages and bringing them through all the time.谁知道呢？ Next year we might get two. And certainly, I can say that the legend is female.”

;

;Earlier this week, Glastonbury festival moved its ticket sales for 2024's event, originally due to begin on Thursday, back by two weeks.

;

;Organisers said the decision was “to ensure that everyone who would like to buy a ticket is registered and therefore eligible to purchase one … it has come to light that some individuals hoping to buy tickets for 2024 have discovered after Monday's registration deadline that they are no longer registered, despite believing they were.” The sale has now been moved “out of fairness to those individuals”.

;

;Tickets will now go on sale at 6pm GMT on Thursday 16 November for packages including coach travel. General admission tickets will go on sale at 9am GMT, Sunday 19 November.

;
;;Jaghtar Singh Johal
;

;Assurances by a UK minister that a British man imprisoned in ;India; will receive a fair trial fly in the face of evidence that he has been tortured and arbitrarily detained, three lawyers who held senior public roles have warned.

;

;To coincide with the sixth anniversary of Jaghtar Singh Johal's detention, ;Sir Ken MacDonald KC;, Elish Angiolini KC and ;Jim Wallace KC; have written to the UK Foreign Office minister, Lord Ahmad, asking him to retract his recent comments saying that the British citizen will receive “due process” in India.

;

;Lord MacDonald, a former director of public prosecutions for England and Wales, and Lady Angiolini and Lord Wallace, who were lord advocate and advocate general respectively for Scotland, say “there can be no due process where proceedings have been tainted by torture”, or where charges are politically motivated and punish freedom of expression.

;

;Johal, a Sikh activist and blogger from Dumbarton, Scotland, was in India in 2017 to get married when he was seized by plainclothes officers in front of his wife, hooded, bundled into a car and tortured, according to the campaign group Reprieve. It says the Indian authorities appear to have acted on a; tip-off from UK intelligence;.

;

;The then prime minister, ;Boris Johnson, said the Indian government was arbitrarily detaining Johal; – a position shared by the ;UN working group on arbitrary detention; – but the government has been accused of since backsliding on its stance. In a ;debate about Johal's case in the House of Lords; in September, Ahmad said the UK would not call for the release of an individual or interfere in another country's legal process “where a due process is being followed”.

;

;In their letter to Ahmad, MacDonald and Wallace write: “There is no possibility of due process in Jagtar's case, which is based around a so-called confession obtained under days of brutal torture. The UK government has acknowledged Jagtar's serious allegations of torture by state officials whilst in pre-trial detention, including electrocution, beatings, stress positions and threats to burn him alive. To bring an end to the torture, Jagtar was forced to sign blank pieces of paper, subsequently represented by the authorities as a 'confession'. This is the primary basis for his continued detention.”

;

;Johal faces terrorism charges in connection with killings by the Khalistan Liberation Force (KLF), a banned terrorist organisation, of which he is alleged to be a member. The peers' letter says that in the six years he has been in jail no credible evidence has been forthcoming and calls on Ahmad to retract his “unsustainable” comments about due process.

;

;In September, Johal's MP, Martin Docherty-Hughes, accused the UK prime minister, Rishi Sunak, of prioritising a trade deal with India over his release after a letter from Ahmad ;said the government would not call for his release;, claiming that taking such a position would not be in his best interests.

;

;Johal's brother, Gurpreet, said: “My brother's trial is a sham and the prime minister and foreign secretary know it. They won't do what it takes to bring him home, so they come up with excuses. It's been six years of endless delays, and while prosecutors drag the process out without presenting any credible evidence, Jagtar is slowly dying in an Indian jail.”

;

;A Foreign Commonwealth and Development Office spokesperson said it was committed to resolving Johal's case “as soon as possible”.

;

;They added: “We continue to provide consular assistance to Mr Johal and his family and have consistently raised his case directly with the government of India.”

; Sun, 05 Nov 2023 16:52:01 +0800 Osaka’s baseball underdogs hope one more win will lift curse of KFChttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/05/osakas-baseball-underdogs-hope-one-more-win-will-lift-curse-of-kfc
;;2023-11-05T05:00:08Z;
;
;;Head coach Akinobu Okada of the Hanshin Tigers is tossed into the air as the team celebrates winning the Central League in September.
;

;The last time the Hanshin Tigers were proclaimed the best baseball team in Japan, their fans celebrated by hurling themselves into a canal and carrying out an “abduction” that many believe placed their team under a curse that has lasted almost four decades.

;

;On Saturday, the sleeping giants of Japanese baseball were forced to wait another day for the chance to banish the jinx by winning their first ;Japan; Series title since 1985, after a defeat to local rivals Orix Buffaloes ensured that the season's finale would go to a seventh and decisive game.

;

;Hanshin never came close to securing their first series title in 38 years at Kyocera Dome in Osaka, after another heroic pitching performance by Yoshinobu Yamamoto helped Orix level the series at 3-3 and set up what promises to be a classic at the same venue – and Orix's home turf – on Sunday.

;

;A Tigers victory in Japan's most popular sport would set off wild celebrations in their home city of Osaka, even though their ballpark, the fabled 99-year-old ;Koshien stadium;, is in the neighbouring Hyogo prefecture.

;

;Hanshin and Orix, who were seeking their second title in a row, have set up a tantalising end to the first Japan Series between two Osaka ball clubs for 59 years. With the series on a knife-edge, the Tigers' raucous supporters filed out of the dome on a sultry evening hoping that their wait would be over in 24 hours' time.

;

;In 1985, the last time Hanshin were victorious in the series, Japan was on the brink of its asset-inflated bubble economy, Margaret Thatcher was Britain's prime minister and Nelson Mandela was still in prison in apartheid South Africa.

;

;Some of the team's fans trace the fallow decades that followed back to the excessive celebrations that greeted their Central League title that year. Not content with leaping, fully clothed, off Ebisubashi bridge into the murky waters of Osaka's Dotonbori canal, a few uprooted a statue of Kentucky Fried Chicken founder Colonel Sanders – who bore a passing resemblance to the team's star slugger that season, the stocky and bearded American Randy Bass – from outside a nearby KFC and dumped him in the water.

;

;Many suspect his rough treatment at the hands of Tigers' fans placed a curse on the team, even after the colonel was ;retrieved from the canal;, minus his spectacles and left hand, during renovation work in 2009.

;

;In the 17 years that followed, Hanshin recorded just two top-three finishes and a glut of last-place finishes, and did not win the league pennant again until 2003. They repeated that feat in 2005, but the series and the title of ;Nippon ichi; (Japan's no 1) eluded them.

;

;“It's been 38 years, so of course there are more nerves than usual,” Yuko Kawase, a Hanshin fan who watches her team about 90 times a season, said on the eve of the series. “But the fans are totally behind the players.”

;

;Masaki Yamaguchi, a 24-year-old Tigers fan who watched Saturday's match on TV, said Yamamoto's pitching had made all the difference. But he had not given up hope. “I wasn't born the last time Hanshin were the best team in Japan, so I'm desperate to see it happen.”

; ;

;That two teams from the Osaka region have made it to the series will have delighted many neutrals who tire of the focus on the Tokyo-based Yomiuri Giants – backed by the influential conservative newspaper the ;Yomiuri Shimbun; – whose loss of form has done little to dim their reputation as Japanese baseball aristocracy, not least among the capital's media.

;

;The Giants dominated the early years of professional baseball in Japan, while the then-named Osaka Tigers, formed in 1935, were considered the country's second team.

;

;But they became a lightning rod for the hopes of people in Kansai – the region of western Japan that includes the major cities of Osaka, Kyoto and Kobe – and sports fans elsewhere in Japan who bristled at the Giants' supremacy.

;

;Despite Hanshin's lack of success, loyalty to the club has spawned a boisterous fan culture unmatched in Japan. When the team are playing at Koshien, the noise can be deafening, especially when an opposition pitch is sent soaring through the sky and into the stands for a home run.

;

;A large police presence in downtown Osaka means there is unlikely to be a repeat of the canal-diving antics should Hanshin win the series decider on Sunday. Instead, the commercial city, whose people pride themselves on their ;carb-heavy street food; and sense of humour, will mark the team's feat with department store sales and cut-price deals at bars and restaurants.

;

;Jason Coskrey, a baseball writer for the ;Japan Times;, said a Hanshin victory in the Japan Series – the country's equivalent of Major League Baseball's World Series in the US – would be a “big deal” for local people.

;

;“The Tigers winning would be a huge celebration for Osaka,” Coskrey said. “The Tigers have not won in so long that the area is ready to burst if they finally get it done again. They have a huge, passionate and proud fanbase.”

;

;As they approach the end of their pennant-winning season, Hanshin fans, players and management have imposed an unofficial ban on uttering the word ;yusho; (victory), fearing they will be jinxed by the merest hint of overconfidence. Instead, they refer to that longed-for outcome as ;are; (you know what).

;

;Only a Japan Series victory will convince Hanshin's long-suffering and superstitious supporters that the curse of the colonel has truly been lifted. All they can do is wait and hope.
